meanings.definition: The quality or state of being indivisible.
meanings.sent1: The indivisibility of the cake made it hard to share.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the indivisibility of the atom.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the indivisibility of the rope.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the twins was like the indivisibility of a mirror's reflection.
meanings.sent5: The concept of indivisibility in math class was quite challenging.

meanings.definition: The inability to be divided or separated.
meanings.sent1: The indivisibility of the team ensured their victory.
meanings.sent2: The mountain's indivisibility from the landscape was striking.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle's pieces seemed to mock the indivisibility of the solution.
meanings.sent4: The indivisibility of the truth from the lie was evident.
meanings.sent5: The indivisibility of the bond between the friends was heartwarming.
